name: UIImagePickerController
desc: A view controller that manages the system interfaces for taking pictures, recording movies, and choosing items from the user's media library.

items.name: delegate
items.desc: The image picker’s delegate object.

items.name: availableMediaTypes
items.desc: Returns an array of the available media types for the specified source type.

items.name: isSourceTypeAvailable
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the device supports picking media using the specified source type.

items.name: sourceType
items.desc: The type of picker interface to be displayed by the controller.

items.name: UIImagePickerController.SourceType
items.desc: The source to use when picking an image or when determining available media types.

items.name: mediaTypes
items.desc: An array indicating the media types to be accessed by the media picker controller.

items.name: allowsEditing
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the user is allowed to edit a selected still image or movie.

items.name: videoQuality
items.desc: The video recording and transcoding quality.

items.name: UIImagePickerController.QualityType
items.desc: Video quality settings for movies recorded with the built-in camera, or transcoded by displaying in the image picker.

items.name: videoMaximumDuration
items.desc: The maximum duration, in seconds, for a video recording.

items.name: showsCameraControls
items.desc: Indicates whether the image picker displays the default camera controls.

items.name: cameraOverlayView
items.desc: The view to display on top of the default image picker interface.

items.name: cameraViewTransform
items.desc: The transform to apply to the camera’s preview image.

items.name: takePicture
items.desc: Captures a still image using the camera.

items.name: startVideoCapture
items.desc: Starts video capture using the camera specified by the UIImagePickerController.CameraDevice property.

items.name: stopVideoCapture
items.desc: Stops video capture.

items.name: isCameraDeviceAvailable
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a given camera is available.

items.name: cameraDevice
items.desc: The camera used by the image picker controller.

items.name: UIImagePickerController.CameraDevice
items.desc: The camera to use for image or movie capture.

items.name: availableCaptureModes
items.desc: Returns an array of NSNumber objects indicating the capture modes supported by a given camera device.

items.name: cameraCaptureMode
items.desc: The capture mode used by the camera.

items.name: UIImagePickerController.CameraCaptureMode
items.desc: The category of media for the camera to capture.

items.name: isFlashAvailable
items.desc: Indicates whether a given camera has flash illumination capability.

items.name: cameraFlashMode
items.desc: The flash mode used by the active camera.

items.name: UIImagePickerController.CameraFlashMode
items.desc: The flash mode to use with the active camera.

items.name: imageExportPreset
items.desc: The preset to use when preparing images for export to your app.

items.name: UIImagePickerController.ImageURLExportPreset
items.desc: Constants indicating how to export images to the client app.

items.name: videoExportPreset
items.desc: The preset to use when preparing video for export to your app.
